bayou.reload

Class VoidCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.reload.VoidCompiler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HotCompiler

    public class VoidCompiler
extends Object
implements HotCompiler
    A HotCompiler that generates no output.

    The purpose of a VoidCompiler is to reload the application if some files are changed (but requiring no recompilation). For example, if the application reads ".properties" files on startup and cache the information in memory, it needs to be reloaded if some of the files are changed.

    See also HotReloader.onFiles(fileDesc, filePattern, srcDirs).

    • Constructor Detail

      • VoidCompiler

        public VoidCompiler(String fileDesc,
                    PathMatcher pathMatcher)
        Create a VoidCompiler.

        fileDesc is used for diagnosis outputs.

        For example: new VoidCompiler("java", FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher("glob:**.java"))

    • Method Detail

      • getPathMatcher

        public PathMatcher getPathMatcher()
        Description copied from interface: HotCompiler
        The PathMatcher for source files.

        Only those files under the srcDirs will be fed to this PathMatcher; only those approved by this PathMatcher are source files for this compiler.

        An example PathMatcher: FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher("glob:**.java").

        Specified by:
        getPathMatcher in interface HotCompiler
        See Also:
        FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String)
